contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Hatnote|This article is about the district in Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan. There is also a city in Ishikawa with this name, see [[Kahoku, Ishikawa]]. For other uses see [[Kahoku (disambiguation)]].}} {{nihongo|'''Kahoku'''|河北郡|Kahoku-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Ishikawa Prefecture|Ishikawa]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 62,374 and a [[population density|density]] of 476.79 persons per km². The total area is 130.82 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Tsubata, Ishikawa|Tsubata]] *[[Uchinada, Ishikawa|Uchinada]] ==Merger== *On March 1, 2004 the towns of [[Takamatsu, Ishikawa|Takamatsu]], [[Nanatsuka, Ishikawa|Nanatsuka]], and [[Unoke, Ishikawa|Unoke]] merged to form the city of [[Kahoku, Ishikawa|Kahoku]]. {{Ishikawa}} {{coord|36.669|N|136.773|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Ishikawa Prefecture]] {{Ishikawa-geo-stub}}
